  <Panel id="overview">

<IntroSection
  id={tabToc.overview[0].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[0].value}
  description="Switch is a component for customizing configurations. It represents a physical switch that allows users to turn things on or off, providing control over actions and preferences. Tapping a toggle switch is a two-step action: selection and execution. It should reflect an action that triggers a state, never both at once."
/>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[1].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[1].value}
>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[2].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[2].value}
>

When using a standalone `Switch` you should provide an `aria-label` property value. As a `form` component, it should have a label specified to guarantee accessibility.

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [checked, setChecked] = React.useState(false)

  return (
    <Switch
      label="Label"
      aria-label="label"
      checked={checked}
      onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
    />
  )
}
```

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[3].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[3].value}
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [checked, setChecked] = React.useState(false)

  return (
    <Switch
      label="Label"
      aria-label="label"
      checked={checked}
      helpText="Help text"
      onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
    />
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[4].id}

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [checked, setChecked] = React.useState(false)

  return (
    <Switch
      label="Label"
      aria-label="label"
      checked={checked}
      error
      errorText="Error text"
      onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
    />
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[6].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[6].value}
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return (
    <>
      <Switch
        label="Label"
        aria-label="label"
        error
        errorText="Error text"
        helpText="Help text"
        onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
        disabled
      />
      <Switch
        label="Label"
        aria-label="label"
        error
        checked
        errorText="Error text"
        helpText="Help text"
        onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
        disabled
      />
    </>
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[7].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[7].value}
  explanation="There are two checked states: `checked`, and `not checked`."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return (
    <>
      <Set>
        <Switch aria-label="label-1" label="Label" />
        <Switch aria-label="label-disabled-1" disabled label="Label" />
      </Set>
      <Set>
        <Switch aria-label="label-2" checked label="Label" />
        <Switch aria-label="label-disabled-2" checked disabled label="Label" />
      </Set>
    </>
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[8].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[8].value}
  explanation="Oftentimes we need to render multiple switches and store the checked values in an array. It can be easily done using our `useSwitchState` hook, you just need to pass the hook return object to the switches `state` property and define a `value` for each `Switch`."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const switchState = useSwitchState({ state: [] })

  return (
    <>
      <Text>Selected switches: {switchState.state.join(', ')}</Text>
      <Switch state={switchState} value="switch1" label="Label" />
      <Switch state={switchState} value="switch2" label="Label" />
      <Switch state={switchState} value="switch3" label="Label" />
    </>
  )
}
```

</PageSection>
</PageSection>
</PageSection>

import { Switch } from '@vtex/admin-ui'

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.codeReference[1].id}
  title={tabToc.codeReference[1].value}
  explanation="There are two ways of handling the state in the Switch."
>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.codeReference[2].id}
  title={tabToc.codeReference[2].value}
  explanation="You can use the properties checked and onChange to handle if the Switch is checked and its values have changed."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [checked, setChecked] = React.useState(false)

  return (
    <Switch
      checked={checked}
      onChange={() => setChecked(!checked)}
      label="Label"
    />
  )
}
```

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.codeReference[3].id}
  title={tabToc.codeReference[3].value}
  explanation="For convenience, we also provide a hook that already implements the state logic for you. It can be very handy if you have a group of switches and want to handle the states of each one. You should pass the hook return to the state property and also define a value for each Switch."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const switchState = useSwitchState({ state: false })

  return <Switch state={switchState} label="Label" />
}
```

</PageSection >
</PageSection >

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.codeReference[4].id}
  title={tabToc.codeReference[4].value}
>

| Name      | Type             | Description                                                                                                                                   | Required | Default |
| --------- | ---------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- | ------- |
| label     | `ReactNode`      | The component's label                                                                                                                         | âœ…       | -       |
| helpText  | `ReactNode`      | Help text                                                                                                                                     | ðŸš«       | -       |
| errorText | `ReactNode`      | Error text                                                                                                                                    | ðŸš«       | -       |
| error     | `boolean`        | Whether the switch contains an error or not                                                                                                   | ðŸš«       | -       |
| checked   | `boolean`        | Switch's checked state. If present, it is used instead of state                                                                               | ðŸš«       | -       |
| disabled  | `boolean`        | Defines if the Switch is disabled or not                                                                                                      | ðŸš«       | -       |
| value     | `string, number` | Switch's value is going to be used when multiple switches share the same state. Checking a switch with a value will add it to the state array | ðŸš«       | -       |
| state     | `SwtichState`    | Return of `useSwitchState` hook. You can also provide these props from your own state logic.                                                  | ðŸš«       | -       |
| csx       | `StyleProp`      | Defines component styles                                                                                                                      | ðŸš«       | `{}`    |

> The Switch component also supports all HTML props from the `<input />` HTML tag.

</PageSection >

<Panel id="designReference">

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.designReference[0].id}
  title={tabToc.designReference[0].value}
>

1. Instant response that triggers a state, and require no further confirmation.
2. List of independent items that represent different features or behaviors.
3. Multually exclusive states, usually on/off type of decision.
4. Use titles to group related controls.
5. Choose words that are aligned with our ecommerce vocabulary.
6. Write the current state of the control, to improve accessibility.
7. Add descriptions if the control is critical, or complex.
8. Lists of controls should be vertical for better scannability.

ðŸ‘‰ For UX Writing guidelines, access https://uxwriting.vtex.com

</PageSection>
